The digitization of currencies, transactions, relationships, experiences and assets has transformed entire industries. Risk Interns are responsible for delivering engagements ranging from business process and information systems controls assessments and testing to support regulatory, compliance and other strategic and operational and attestation engagements.

Risk Advisory Services Essential Duties And Responsibilities
Evaluate and test business processes and IT controls and identify areas of risk
Apply current knowledge of trends to identify business risk management issues and other opportunities for improvement
Work with the client to plan engagement strategy, define objectives, and address business risks and issues and supporting controls

Please Note
This opportunity is available for our Boise office location
You will be considered for both the ASCEND and 2022 internship in the same interview process.
The 2021 ASCEND Summer Leadership Program will be held virtually.

What You’ll Experience

We’re excited to introduce the new ASCEND program, which is a week-long program that will highlight our firm culture and provide you with the opportunity to explore various service lines, learn more about our Internal Mobility program, and discuss trends with some of Armanino’s most innovative practitioners. The main focus of our ASCEND program will be service line case studies where you will receive hands-on experience doing work that our professionals do on a daily basis. During your 2022 internship, you will gain hands-on experience working alongside professionals at all levels (associate to partner), who will provide insight into the field of public accounting. In the first week of the internship, you'll experience New Employee Orientation (NEO), service line-specific training, and introductions to your mentor team (intern Buddy and Performance Coach). Selected Fridays of your internship, you will get together with your intern group to participate in cross-functional or professional development training, followed by a social event with colleagues.

Your internship will provide you with the same exposure to Armanino as our associate level hires, while participating in interactive and engaging programming!

Prepare Corporate, Partnership, Trust and Individual tax returns on behalf of clients
Research changes in tax regulation and develop tax planning skills
Work as an individual contributor and as part of a team to support client engagements
Work with a team of 2-4 professionals on client projects (staff, senior, manager and partner)
Develop an understanding of and capability in accounting, financial and database software
Develop administrative, professional and interpersonal skills to the extent of being able to organize, analyze and communicate with others in a productive and efficient manner

What You’ll Need
Currently enrolled in a Bachelor's or Master’s program in business with an emphasis in accounting or taxation
Final graduation date/CPA eligibility date (whichever comes later) between December 2022 and August 2023 strongly preferred
Minimum 3.0 GPA preferred
Basic knowledge of accounting principles
Experience with Microsoft Suite (i.e. Word, Excel, Power Point)
